file_content.text: You really saved our skins. A battalion of walkers would have been the end of us.
Those overload modules worked like a charm. The walkers are out of commission.
I took care of the walkers.
I knew you'd make it! And I heard you took out that active walker, too. Wish I could've seen it.
I knew you'd make it! I just wish I could've been there.
It was your modules that destroyed those walkers. You saved lives.
Be proud of your contribution.
Thank you. It means a lot to know I made a difference. Be safe.
I doubt this was the last item in the Empire's bag of tricks.
Don't get too comfortable.
For now, it just feels good to buy Balmorra some time. Thank you.
I'm the best, kid.
No argument here. Stay safe. And thank you.
Hurry! If the Empire gets those walkers mobilized, we could lose all of Balmorra.
There's a walker online already? I thought we had more time!
No, the modules are done, but it doesn't matter if no one can get close... wait, I gotta go.
Master Jedi! You could get past a walker, right? You've got to....
Captain! You're Havoc Squad! You could get past a walker, right? You've got to....
Hey, you're that privateer! You could get past a walker, right? You've got to....
Hey, I've heard of you! You could get past a walker, right? You've got to....
Still your mind and explain. Is there an attack?
You must calm yourself.
Brief me like a professional or I can't help.
Hey! Pull it together.
Take it easy and tell me what's going on.
Relax. What's wrong?
Sorry, it's just... walkers get me a little anxious. The Empire just launched the first of a whole battalion they're building.
Private Reed. I'm building hardware to sabotage the Empire's walker construction program. Unfortunately, the scum just launched their first unit.
Walkers are dangerous. I like being alive.
I'd rather not....
Please hear me out! The Empire's building a battalion of walkers at the Balmorran Arms Factory. They've already got one running.
Those machines are serious. I saw one in action at the outpost where I was first stationed.
We were ready--troops, battle droids, hardened turrets. But when that walker was done... there was just a crater full of crushed metal.
If we don't sabotage the rest of the battalion before it comes online, they could take Balmorra in one sweep.
I assume you have a plan.
Sabotage them how?
Yeah. Too bad for the Imperials I'm not some useless kid anymore.
You've convinced me. I'll find a way to stop the walkers.
No time to waste.
Here, I built these overload modules. Plant one on each unit in the factory, and it'll fry their systems permanently.
Their active walker will probably be patrolling outside. If you can destroy it, great.
You're sure you're not overstating things?
I think you're exaggerating.
I know the specs on these things. They'll crush us. But we can still stop them.
I built a batch of overload modules. My own design. They'll permanently fry the systems on those walkers.
But planting them means getting past that active walker first. Can you do that?
Those walkers will never leave that factory.
Of course.
We cannot allow the Empire such power.
I'm willing to risk it.
No chance they'll get those walkers mobilized.
I'll take care of it.
Don't worry, kid. I'll take care of those walkers.
Sure thing.
One day I'll call in a favor, and you'll say yes. Understand?
Fine, but you'll owe me.
Uh... okay, I guess I understand. Here, these are the overload modules.
Oh... well, I guess I can scrape some credits together. Don't worry, I'll think of something.
If you can destroy that active walker patrolling outside the factory, great.
But if it's too tough, just get past it. The ones inside are the real threat.
I'll pass. [Refuse quest]
Well, there goes Balmorra.
Can't talk. I have to get these overload modules finished.
With those bombers destroyed, we can go back to fighting men, not machines.
All intel reports the Empire's bombers are history. The entire shipyard is wiped out-- I don't know how you did it!
I've got to give you credit, Private. Your solution was a good one, once we found someone crazy enough to try it.
You'll get your chance.
You've got to take out those bombers, or we might as well pack up now.
That's no solution, Reed. Those bombers are heavily guarded. We just don't have the skills to--
Hey! Halt there! Your squad's better equipped than my entire platoon. You've got to help us!
Master Jedi! Wait, please-- I don't mean to be rude, but you've got to help us. It's your duty!
Wait. I know that logo anywhere. That's Havoc Squad! Captain, over here! We need your help!
Hey, you! You're that merc, right? The one who's been pulling special ops across Balmorra?
If we don't do something about the Empire's new bombers, every Republic outpost will be a smoldering crater by sundown!
I'm sorry. It's just chaos out here-- the minute we take down one Imperial defense, that factory pumps out another.
I hope you're kidding.
If you were hoping for shore leave, you landed on the wrong planet. In this sector, the Empire's fighting for keeps.
That sounds about right.
With all due respect, we're doing our best out here. But we can't predict what that factory's going to spit out next!
The Balmorran Arms Factory's got an experimental shipyard. They've developed stealth bombers-- small, fast ships designed to hammer us into oblivion.
So what can we do?
Then get to it, soldier!
We don't have the resources for this large an assault. But we do have a plan.
Private Reed here's been studying our recon data. He's developed a way to disable the bombers from the ground.
We can't offer any support. You'd be making a solo assault into the factory shipyard, and it's crawling with Imps.
Then you need my help.
I'm Havoc Squad, aren't I?
I've done stupider things.
Can you offer a reward?
Coordinates to the shipyard, and instructions on how to install the modules. Reed will monitor them from here.
If you can pull this off, you'll save the Republic war effort on Balmorra. Get out there and scrap those bombers!
